intro: Toxicodendron verrucosum, commonly known as the roughleaf sumac, is a shrub native to North America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fuzzy berries. Its sap contains urushiol, a toxic resin that can cause skin irritation in humans. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
